question: BERA is a reliable indicator in the diagnosis of:
exp: The best audiometric test for acoustic neuroma is BERA. The most diagnostic finding suggestive of acoustic neuroma on BERA is increased interaural latency of wave V of > 0. 2 ms.
topic_name: Diseases of Inner Ear and Vestibular Schwannoma

question: All of the following are true about Schwannomas except
exp: Option A: Vestibular schwannoma is benign neoplasm of unceain etiology that most often affects Inferior vestibular nerve. Option B: Cochleovestibular symptoms are earliest symptoms when tumour is still intracanalicular and are caused by pressure on cochlear or vestibular nerve fibres or on the internal auditory aery. Option C: MRI with gadolinium contrast is superior to CT scan and is gold standard for diagnosis of acoustic neuroma. Option D: VIIth nerve involvement: Sensory fibres are affected early. There is hypoaesthesia of posterior meatal wall (Hitzelberger's sign), loss of taste (as tested by electrogustometry) and reduced lacrimation on Schirmer test. Motor fibres are more resistant and are affected late. Delayed blink reflex may be an early manifestation.
opa: Commonly arises from Superior vestibular nerve
opc: Gd enhanced MRI is the most sensitive investigation
opd: Hitzelberg's sign is due to involvement of 7th nerve

question: A steel worker presented with noise induced hearing loss, which pa of inner ear is most likely affected?
exp: NIHL cause damage to hair cells, staing in the basal turn of cochlea. Outer hair cells are affected before the inner hair cells. Outer hair cells are more in number and rows. More sensitive to noise induced hearing loss as well as to ototoxic drugs. Stereocilia of outer hair cells first to be affected by noise induced hearing loss.
